DPRK Women's Football Team Wins Gold Medal In 15th Asiad
articles.content:
DPRK Women's Football Team Wins Gold Medal In 15th Asiad 
   Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- The DPRK team won the gold medal in the women's football tournament of the 15th Asiad.
 The DPRK team won all the matches it played in the preliminary round and semi-finals. And it defeated Japan 4:2 on penalties after drawing 0:0 in the first and second halves and even in extra time in the finals on Wednesday.    
 The DPRK team won the Asiad title in the wake of its victory in the 14th Asiad in 2002.

Greetings to Malaysian King
   Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People�fs Assembly, sent a message to Al-Wathiqu Billah Tuanku Mizan Zainal Abidin Ibni Al-Marhum Sultan Mahmud Al-Muktafi Billah Shah upon his accession to the Malaysian throne on Thursday.
 The message expressed belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in various fields and wished the King and the Malaysian people great success in their work for the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: "Osandok Prize" Sports Contests Open
articles.content:
"Osandok Prize" Sports Contests Open
   Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- The "Osandok Prize" Sports Contests opened with due ceremony at the Ice Rink Friday in the run-up to the birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk. 
  The contests involve ice hockey, figure skating, short track speed skating and bowling.    
 Among those present at the opening ceremony was Kim Jung Rin, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
